Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonable value.”
Reviews.Author: Legar
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for an overnight Sydney sojourn for my wife and I for its proximity to Central Station which is a junction for all rail routes including the route to and from the airport. The hotel is also on the door step of Chinatown and Paddy's Markets with easy access (walk or bus) to all the other attractions, sites and shopping that Sydney has to offer. The hotel is apparently heritage listed which is evident with much of the period features and original character remaining. A facelift with a splash of colour and perhaps a change to some of the interior decor, fixtures and fittings would provide the Grande touch an old lady deserves. The rooms are quite small, dated and could do with a lick of paint where bags and furniture have scared the walls. The carpet is nearing the end of its life and attention to detail in the housekeeping, particularly the bathroom where mould is evident in some of the tile grouting and base of the glass shower screen. The shower recess is very tight so watch the elbows and hands. Our bed was a king (two singles pushed together) which was reasonably comfortable. The air conditioning worked, the TV (an old style flat screen) functioned correctly the bar fridge kept our drinks cold, the kettle boiled and was clean and there was an iron and ironing board. Compact but satisfactory. Oh! don't expect a view of the Opera House or Harbor Bridge...we had a view to the overhead of diners down stairs, a brick wall and external walkway. Overall there is nothing wrong with this hotel. Reasonably clean, friendly front of house staff, and small but adequate rooms. A respectable 3 star hotel with an affordable tariff by Sydney accommodation standards. As a house guest I did find the $2.00 per bag/day storage fee a little unreasonable but with no where else to store bags while waiting for your room on check in or late departures from the city...you don't have much choice.

Reviews.Title: “central good value location”
Reviews.Author: castlehawking0708
Reviews.Content: We found this on laterooms at a very good price for the 2 nights we needed between flying in from Brisbane and leaving for Heathrow. Tube straight from Domestic and back out to International airports arrives at Central station after 2 stops. The hotel is a short 200 yard walk from there. Into reception and registered very efficiently with key card to room. Rooms are everything you'd expect for a 'stay over' if you're not looking for a romantic break or spending a load of time there. Shower room good with fridge, kettle and drinks as expected. Reasonably quiet even though we were in a room facing across George Street and towards the station. No complaints whatsoever. Walk back across the road towards station to take a tour bus around Sydney as we try to do in most places we go to get an idea of the location of everything. We concluded that there aren't many places not easily accessible from here and indeed we walked most of the way up George Street to Hotel on Sunday night after a last drink with our boys at Harbourside. No frills but good honest service provision at a reasonable cost in the right place. Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Ladleenz
Reviews.Content: My 1st time to Sydney...got great hotel that near with attraction places...very near to Chinatown as well as Darling Harbour which just a few blocks from hotel....good location for travelers who doesn't spend much time in hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: This place was ideal for the night between arriving on a cruise and leaving on an early morning train. There was a bus direct from the cruise terminal and it's a short walk to Central Station. I was never sure whether this was a classic heritage hotel or just very old fashioned. It's certainly not up to 4 star standards. The room was small with no view but it was very quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel bistro was closed for a private function so we had our dinner in the pub section which was typical but good pub food.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: Maureen G
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney to see a show and organised an overnight stay at The Great Southern. We found the hotel very clean, quiet and the staff most accommodating, and the rooms spacious. Breakfast was delightful. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick stay.”
Reviews.Author: rekah21
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided on the Great Southern as we were only in Sydney for the night and decided not to waste money on an expensive hotel. The hotel was an easy walk from Central Station and easy to spot. Although we were checking in at about 9am, our room was ready and we were able to go straight in. The room was basic but considering we only needed it for sleeping it wasn't an issue. We had a room facing the inner courtyard, and noticed a door to allow it to be connecting room. The Great Southern is definitely in the perfect location for not only exploring the markets (there's a back entrance that comes out almost opposite the Paddy Market entrance) but Sydney itself as its location on George Street provides plenty of options in sights, eateries and shopping within a short walk. The bar within the Great Southern also had well priced drinks and delicious pizzas on our last visit to Sydney (we stayed elsewhere during that trip) Upon returning to the hotel in the evening, we tried to use the internet kiosks in the lobby which unfortunately froze with personal accounts open. As we didn't have an Australian phone we tried asking the gentleman on the front desk if we could use their phone to call the company. He was very reluctant to help us, even to use the phone and although the problem did eventually get fixed, we were disappointed with his attitude. The beds were comfortable and we settled in for a LONG sleep after a busy day. Then, just after 5am, we were woken up by all the noise coming from the connecting room. Yelling and throwing items not only in the room but the hallway too. Although it was over quickly, it did impact our overall experience. However, The Great Southern is good value for money and a good choice if you plan on taking full advantage of everything in Sydney and want something basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Shes186258
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 3 nights at this hotel and we were very pleasantly surprised, after we had read some of the negative reviews we weren't sure what to expect. It surpassed our expectations and more ! Yes a small room with no view but extremely clean, fresh quality bedding, refilled tea/coffee, shampoo/liquid soap, clean towels every day, room always made up whenever we returned. Hardly any noise in our room and were never kept awake. Breakfast choice brilliant, you could even juice your own carrots and celery ! Plenty of cooked choices, though they needed to be a bit hotter. Evening pub grub excellent too ! Good value for money, as we are finding Australia to be very expensive ! Location great for station, Darling Harbour, markets and China Town, we walked everywhere and were always pleased to return for a rest !!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to Central Station & The Haymarket. VG value”
Reviews.Author: Matelot111
Reviews.Content: My wife & I tried this hotel for the first time 2/3 April 2012 & quite by accident. We needed a comfortable room for just one night & very close to Central rail station due to our travel schedule. Despite a late arrival we were offered an unsolicited upgrade from a standard double to an executive suite on the top floor with views to the north. The suite was well equipped, neat & well presented. We had an excellent night's sleep in a very large & comfortable bed with no building or city noises; a real surprise as this location is one of the busiest traffic wise in Sydney. We did not dine in the restaurant or purchase the breakfast offers available at reception. This is a listed heritage hotel which may not appeal to all ages. A slight criticism would be stains in carpets which detracted somewhat, a minor criticism in the overall scheme of things. Night reception lady was efficient, polite & helpful. Check-out staff at 1000 very busy & some delay of 10-15 minutes should be expected. Having the option of a shower/bath was a real plus after a long day of rail travel. We came away refreshed & assessed the GSH as representing very good value. Whether a standard room without the much welcomed upgrade would have impressed us as much is, of course, open to conjecture. We will return to the GSH next time in Sydney & recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Excellent Location....ignore the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money and the room was fine, the bed was huge, clean & comfortable. Bathroom was clean with nice clean towels, as someone said in another review there were no hand towels but hey if you're complaining about that then you'll complain about anything! We opted for the no housekeeping rather than pay $20 per night and it was fine, we just left dirty linen outside the door and collected fresh from reception. The reception staff were friendly and courteous and yes they charge to store your luggage but it's only $2 per bag so why would you complain about that? The location is perfect, 2-3 mins walk from Central Station, 5 mins from Chinatown & Paddy's Market, 10 mins from Darling Harbour & about 30-35 mins to Circular Quays. Lookout for the free shuttle bus that runs from Central Station down George St to Circular Quays ( no 555) All in all I would recommend this hotel as it's a good price for an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks attention to detail!”
Reviews.Author: debbiefrances
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 25th March - 29th March 2012 with my 11 year old daughter. First impressions were good as the reception area was nice and clean and welcoming, but that's where it ended. We were dropped off outside the hotel to be greeted with a flight of steps. After travelling 10 hours from Thailand someone to help with our luggage would have been a welcome sight but instead I had to struggle with 2 suit cases and 2 lots of hand luggage up the steps. At reception we were given our room cards and told "we were lucky' as our rooms were ready, other wise we would have had to wait until the afternoon (we arrived at 10am). When we saw our room we were very disappointed to say the least. The room was dark and dingy with old brown blankets on the beds, the carped was dirty and worn and even had an iron mark on it. There was a socket hanging off the wall next to the bed. The TV remote had no batteries, the light switch was cracked and the bathroom tap was missing the "cold" sign. All the signs and notices were yellow from age. The beds were very soft and uncomfortable, the clock next to the bed didn't work, I experienced that when I set the alarm to wake us and it failed! There were no hand towels for the whole of our stay even when I requested then we were given a bath mat! On the second day even the swipe cards did not work the lift. We had to pay for the safe in the room the internet in the hotel and to store bags. All in all I wouldn't stay here again unless there were no other hotels available. The only positive was that it was less that 10mins walk to Darling Harbour and 5 mins to Central station, and it had tea making facilities and a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “If necessary, for one night only!”
Reviews.Author: danym_1981
Reviews.Content: Overall, a disappointing experience. Definitely not at the standards of a 4 star hotel. The room was very dingy with old carpeting. The bathroom was in need of a revamp. The bed was very uncomfortable; we would wake up with sore backs every morning. Worst thing was that the walls were paper thin, so EVERYTHING could be heard in the next room. As for the location, very good. Right on George street and close to the Central station. Buses close as well. Friendly enough staff. Don't agree with charging to store our luggage since our flight was in the afternoon and we had to check out by 10 so we carried our bags with us. Ok for 1-2 nights but try something else for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Shari L
Reviews.Content: It isn't the Four Seasons but, at less than a 1/3 the price, I didn't expect it to be the Four Seasons. The location isn't bad (in Chinatown where there are lots of tasty things to eat even late in the evening), public transport is nearby and the place was clean, nice, and very friendly. The rooms were small but "well appointed" as they like to say and the place exceeded my expectations. I will certainly stay there the next time I travel to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to Central train station. Nothing flash, but fine if you are in transit!”
Reviews.Author: tamaletown
Reviews.Content: No problems with this hotel. Stayed a few nights with a friend. Basic but functional. Very close to Central Train Station (which takes you to the airport without a hassle). Walking distance into the CBD, Chinatown right there. No flash places to eat that we found nearby, but lots of cheap eats - particularly Asian options! This was the most affordable, central location that we found. Probably won't be in a huge hurry to rebook, but it suited our purposes! Recommended if you are only staying a night or two, and if you aren't planning on spending any time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Sandra A
Reviews.Content: Nothing special here except close to most attractions and the train and bus service. Good steaks and good value but really just a pub that has had a bit of a make over in the last couple of years. Rooms ordinary. Wouldn't stay here again although staff were lovely and I guess was one of the cheap places considering location.

Reviews.Title: “It is OK.”
Reviews.Author: komsAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Great Southern Hotel for two nights a several days ago. The location of this hotel is good but not very special. Itâ€™s true that it is short distance from the Central Station and only a short walk to Paddyâ€™s market or Chinatown. But to some of the other more notable attractions such as the Opera House, Botanic Gardens or Harbour Bridge, itâ€™s a long way to walk. Luckily trains and buses are just a stone's throw away. To save us some money we booked, the so called â€œNo Housekeepingâ€� room. It only means that housekeeping people will not enter your room (to make your bed and clean your room) but fresh towels and amenities can be collected anytime from hotelâ€™s reception if needed. Any dirty towels, rubbish bags can be left outside your room for collection between 9am- 2pm. If you change your mind about the housekeeping service it will cost you $20.oo per day. The no housekeeping option is a great idea. Our room was on the 3rd floor. It was basic. It wasnâ€™t spacious (rather small) but was spotless. (The whole hotel was clean and well maintained I must say.) We had no view from the window. The window was facing a wall but it was better than the room we were allotted first. The first room we were allocated was on the 5th floor and had no window. A seasoned traveller I knew that we would have problems with the room. Since we travel often to Sydney I know that not all the rooms have windows so I specifically requested a window in our room when we booked as I suffer from claustrophobia. To my horror we got allotted the room without a window. It was solid brick all around. We went back to the reception to complain and to my horror the two receptionists tried to tell me that what we saw was not a wall but a curtain. So we went back to the room to check and not to our surprise it was still a big wall. Anyways, luckily someone from management told the receptionist to give us better room and we were put in the 3rd floor room with a window. This room had a TV but with limited TV channels. No digital channels and only paid movies available. Air-conditioning was programmed to 20 degrees and nothing could be done to change the temperature. The unit was a bit noisy but not too annoying. Our bed was comfortable. We had 2 sets of pillows to choose from (two soft and 2 harder ones). The little en-suit was very clean with nice white, thick and fluffy towels. To finish- WARNING the rooms are small and avoid room 517 if you claustrophobic. Furthermore, they charge for luggage holding. It is $2 per piece which is not expensive but I think it is a bit of a rip- off especially if it is for a few hours. This service should be free for hotel guests. We may stay in The Great Southern Hotel again if we don't find anything closer to the city for this price.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: physigirl
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff,I have stayed here on several occasions and the rooms have always been clean and well stocked with tea,coffee etc. If you do not want to eat "in-house" there are plenty of alternatives close-by.The hotel is across the road(George St) from Central station ,with Paddy's market behind and Darling Harbour near-by

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: dmb987654321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night upon arriving in sydney after a long flight. The location is excellent, 5 mins away fromthe central station. Our room was very nice and quite spacious. Our rate did not include breakfast, but there is a pubstyle resturant downstairs which does breakfast, so that was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...but certainly not special in any way”
Reviews.Author: cattylady
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights prior to a cruise. Because we arrived before 2.00pm our room was not ready - that was fine except, being made to pay for storage of our luggage until it was. I consider that a stay of 3 nights warrants free storage of luggage!! The breakfast has plenty of selection but as has been previously commented on, is lukewarm and soggy AND expensive. The room we had on floor 4 was not spacious but ok, was dark and gloomy looking onto a inner centrum of walls and windows. Very uninspiring and miserable. However it was spotlessly clean. As has also been said, the location is perfect for getting around. Trains and buses all within a stones throw. Would I stay again or recommend - no. You will find better and more exciting accommodation for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: emomum1
Reviews.Content: e stayed in a small very clean and very basic room.The location was great and we were able to explore Sydney from this base using excellent public transport that was easily accessed from the hotel.I loved the wood paneled walls in the lift lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and inexpensive - but done well”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: This is essentially an old pub (hotel) but has been tastefully renovated. The hotel is located just near the Chinatown and theatre area and is only 250 metres from Central Station and the interstate coach stops. The hotel is comfortable, quiet, clean and well maintained. A warning though - the rooms are small. If you're simply looking for somewhere inexpensive (its often possible to get a room for $70) to use as a base to explore Sydney, then this is a great option. The restaurant offers a good range of quite cheap quality meals and you can relax over a few beers in the bar at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this palce maybe look shaggy outside inside is fablous”
Reviews.Author: rebecca w
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel i stay here all the time when im in sydney,,,the rooms are fablous and its close to paddys...10/10...love it

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location but.............”
Reviews.Author: TimberBlueMountains
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Great Southern for the 3rd time. On our two previous visits we were offered an upgrade upon checking in and both times our rooms were very spacious, both times were double rooms( lounge and bedroom) with large flat screens in both rooms, and views of Sydney skyline, Darling Harbour etc. What a surprise to arrive this time for a two nights stay to walk into the smallest hotel room in Sydney, complete with a view directly into the window of another room Wow! we requested an upgrade and were told that we could be moved into a larger room with a view the following day, we were even given the room number. We packed our bags the following morning, put them into the storeroom and came back about 3pm collected our room cards and went to our new room. (not the one allotted to us the previous day though). The room was about one square metre larger than the previous, and the view was of a different window of another room. Very disappointed. We had commented on the standard of the buffet breakfast on our last visit but nothing has changed. For what you pay you receive a very poor selection, lukewarm, and often a wait for plates, cups or cuttlery. Also the restocking of the food as it is consumed takes a long while. The coffee is appalling. On the second morning we tried the "Great Sanger", please don't repeat our error. This is served in a polystyrene container which you must take away, I suppose it is so that other guests cant see this train wreck of a "meal". As you have to wait for this delight, one would expect it to have been cooked for you, but no, staff must just wander out to the buffet and select some lukewarm items and throw them onto two pieces of cold soggy toast. Being handed your breakfast and expected to be on your way is also slightly demeaning. The positives: The location, we have used the Hotel to stay prior to flying overseas and it is very very handy to Central Station, buses to get to Circular Quay, the Rocks etc, right at the Markets and not too far to walk to Darling Harbour if you wish. The Decor, love the use of so much of the old Hotel in the refurbishment. Very nice indeed. The Pub. They serve cold beer and good reasonably priced pub food. We may stay again, but can't guarantee it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: traveler01101986
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for with this hotel. The best part is how convenient it is to shops, restaurants and transportation. The cafe across the street is the best to pick up breakfast on your walk to Central Station. We stayed here 3 nights and while the room is not huge, it's comfortable enough with a TV and mini fridge and the room itself is neat and clean. Large enough space for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view - of a wall”
Reviews.Author: merrickPhomPenh
Reviews.Content: We paid over Au$1000 for 3 nights over New Year. For this, we got a tiny basic room facing a wall. To add insult to injury, we had to pay an extra Au$3 a day to use the safe in the room! Plus a charge to store a couple of bags for two hours. In summary, an absolute rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Mousecook
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel in November and found it very reasonable for the area. While it is a distance from the harbor, there is a free bus that runs up and down George St. to the harbor. It is also close to the Cityrail terminal. The pub in the hotel had a small pub menu and it was quite good. The hotel rooms are small, but were clean,with comfortable beds, had good TV and a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingEddie
Reviews.Content: This is good hotel in a good location near Central staion walking and on George Street, you can walk down several hundred yards and get the 555 free bus straight down to circular Quay and bcak again. You can also walk at night through China town and down to Darling Harbour greta atmosphere. The hotel is an old one but very clean with pleassant staff. We did not eat in. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, breakfast and service!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAust
Reviews.Content: I could not be more pleased with this hotel - it was a great selection. Excellent location, clean and tidy room and friendly service. The room was a little small, but was clean, had relatively new furnishings, and a great view over Sydney. They offer a room service minibar, for very reasonable prices. The hotel contains an internet terminal in reception, a business centre, a small gym (for a $10 fee), and a laundry. In-room broadband access is available for a fee. We received fantastic service from the moment we walked in - we arrived at 9am, and they waived the $2 baggage storage fee. We used this facility again several days after checking out - we travelled into the Blue Mountains for a few days, but had a day to spare in Sydney before catching our 9pm train back home, and the Great Southern Hotel looked after our bags for us for $4 for the day, even though we were no longer guests (thanks Tom & Julian). Here's why we were grateful: there is no luggage storage available in Central Station, and there are few opportunities for baggage storage in the CBD. We were quoted between $16 and $33 per bag per day in other places we contacted, so this really was a fantastic service. The breakfast was great - we got a special when booking through Qantas.com that included breakfast in our room price. The breakfast is $18 each otherwise, and is the standard buffet fare of full English, pancakes, cereal, fruit and toast. There is a pub attached to the hotel (which wasn't noisy at all) that offers lunch and dinner. We paid about $150 a night, which is pretty good for central Sydney, and especially good value during the busy Christmas/New Year period. This hotel would be perfect for business travellers, with the great location and breakfast. There's been a couple of reviews complaining about the distance the hotel is from Central Station - it really is only about 100m at most. The signage in Central Station was a little confusing - in pointing us to George St, it took us the long way around to the hotel. If you come out the front of the station (ie, directly opposite the country platforms) and look left (up Eddy Ave), you will see the facade of the hotel. The hotel is also close to the light rail, which can take you straight into Darling Harbour and to The Star. There is also a Free CBD Shuttle, which provides easy access to Circular Quay, operating out of the bus stands in Eddy Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller_114
Reviews.Content: The Great Southern Hotel is conveniently located in Sydney CBD. A 5 minute walk from Central Station, less than 10 minute ride by train from Sydney airport. The Great Southern is within walking distance to Paddy's Market (100m) and China Town (200m). Beyond that, there is easy access to great restaurants and shopping. I arrived at The Great Southern on Christmas Day with my partner. We stayed a total of three nights. During this time, staffing was at an absolute minimum. There was no room service during this holiday period, so our two small rubbish bins were overflowing by the second day, and we ran out of toilet paper. However, when we requested more toilet paper and fresh towels at reception, the staff were more than obliging. The trade off for the convenience of location would probably be the small room and noise. We were staying next to a room of noisy neighbours who talked and giggled into the early hours of the morning. The paper thin walls meant that even the opening and closing of drawers could be clearly heard, resulting in poor sleep for me and my partner. When I reserved the hotel online, there was no breakfast included in the price of the room. The room had to be paid in full and was not refundable. When we arrived at the hotel, there were many posters and advertising of the breakfast options, both around the hotel and in the room. Option A was the buffet breakfast for $19 p.p. and Option B was The Great Sanger (a sandwich with egg, bacon, sausage, hash brown, cheese and tomato sauce) with either a coffee or a juice for $8. Since I am not a big eater, Option B seemed like a reasonable choice, and well priced as well. Breakfast tickets could be purchased at reception the day before, and handed to the waiter in the morning. We bought two tickets for The Great Sanger on the first night and headed downstairs to the restaurant for breakfast on the second day. Upon handing in our tickets, we were informed that The Great Sanger was a takeaway option only (later we realised that it was stated in the fine print on the posters, but it was not mentioned at reception when we purchased our tickets). We were handed two paper cups and our sandwiches in styrofoam packaging, which frankly seemed like a waste of packaging since the restaurant was mostly empty when we arrived. We headed back up to our room to enjoy our takeaway breakfast, which was surprisingly good and filling. Check out time is 10am, and on our final day in Sydney our flight wasn't until after 4pm. The Great Southern has a bag holding service for $2 per item which we took advantage of. Overall, our stay at The Great Southern was quite pleasant. The price of the room varied night to night, but for the three day total, the cost was very reasonable for the peak holiday period. I would recommend The Great Southern to anyone on a budget who doesn't want to stay in a backpacker hostel or if you don't have a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Southern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dispirit
Reviews.Content: Come for the location and stay for the location. We stayed two nights for a recent trip to Sydney and found this hotel very good for service, great breakfast and perfect location. The room is small but sufficient for holidaying. Bed is very comfy and all amenities that are needed. Shower is also compact but very clean. We were checked in early which is helpful and all enquiries were dealt with kindly. The downstairs pub is a great meeting spot for friends and family with outdoor seating area to watch the city walk by. Meals very popular and tasty. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a backpacker, you'll love it.”
Reviews.Author: foxycruiser
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter & I stayed here 5 nights in Dec. When I was checking out, I told my granddaughter the hotel is supposed to be 4 star but is more like a 2 star. Another guest behind me said, "you would give them that many stars?". No ice machines or ice buckets, they give you a trash bag & you go to the bar next door. Cockroaches climb out of the bathroom plumbing at night. Blankets were clean (I hope) but obvious old stains on one. Paper thin walls, I knocked 3x on one to quiet them down next door. They charge an extra 2% if you use a credit card, charge $2.00 per bag for storage & you MUST check out by 10 am or you are charged for another day. Good luck trying to check in before 2 or 3 pm. It is a block away from the Central train station, about a block away from the bus pickup, Paddy's Market & the mall are right behind it so it does have the location. Still, there must be better places for the same price. I will check elsewhere next time. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Central Stopover" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seaspirals
Reviews.Content: Booked one night on our way from Newcastle to NZ through the Entertainment Book not expecting much as it was v.cheap for Sydney. Trip Advisor reviews tipped the balance and came through for us once again. Excellent location, room was smallish but bathroom was big and v.clean. Comfy bed and quiet considering we were on George St. Didn't try the pub grub as we had dumplings and dessert at 2 favourite places both within 2 minutes walk of the hotel. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Goodbeard
Reviews.Content: A stones throw from Central Station this makes for easy commutes when on business. Decent breakfast available and quiet clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, good price, old-style hotel charm”
Reviews.Author: Erasmus66
Reviews.Content: The Great Southern is a completely renovated art-deco hotel just a two minute walk from Central Station and only a few minutes from Darling Harbour. It is ideally situated for people who do not want to pay the earth but who want to be within easy reach of all Sydney's main attractions. The rooms are a bit small but are tastefully decorated and well serviced. Good quality and well-priced meals are served in the main bar and the open dining area. Good value for money in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “1930's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happysmile123
Reviews.Content: We were here for 7 nights during our months stay in Australia. We found it really close to the train station, which was just as well as when we left there was a down pour and we didn't get too wet due to distance and protection from the shop canopys! We found the hotel to be clean, the beds were comfortable and the location was brilliant for us as we did not mind the walk to Darling Harbour or the Circluar Quay to see the sites. Our room was on the 4th floor and very mostly quiet except when the bins were emptied at 4 am two mornings (this was to be expected as the room was at the back of the hotel and overlooked Paddy's Market and the Chinese quarter resturant). We mostly ate out but on two occasions we used the hotel facilities in the evening and found the food to be very acceptable and good value. The bathroom was small but adequate and toiletries replaced regularly, there was only 2 small towels provided, but we were able to obtain more from reception, but the cleaners always only ever left us with two until I left them a note! The room was small, which was OK, but there was not enough drawer space or enough hangers in the wardrobe for our stay or bedside lamps, only spot lights in the ceiling. There was a stand for suitcases which we did not use as it would have been in the way. The room had a safe for which there was a charge as was internet use for our laptop. I was dissapointed that although we had pre-paid for the hotel, we were not told fully about the 50 dollar bond and came back one night to find both our room cards de-activated. We were paying for internet use and the safe and as this had gone over the 50 dollar max I had to pay for what we had used already and then pay the remainder when we checked out. I was taken aback as in our previous hotel (4 star) we had not pre-paid, but did not have to settle up until we were checking out , I was just asked for my card details. The reception staff were efficient, but not over friendly, the resturant and bar staff were brilliant and really chatty and made us feel very welcome. Overall a good stay and I would go back again if visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ben29000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located close to the central station (3/5 minutes) from which you can take trains/buses to go anywhere in Sydney or in Australia. It is also close to the Central Business District (15/20 minutes walking), the Chinese district, etc. The rooms are not that big (15mÂ²) but it is enough if you stay only for a couple of days in Sydney. The bathroom is rather small but clean and in a good condition. The rooms are quite well insulated and quiet. There is a restaurant/pub on the ground floor and you can also have breakfast there. The buffet is quite expensive (19 AUD) but you have lots of cafÃ©s and restaurants nearby where you can have breakfast in the morning for 8/12 AUD. Conclusion : a good hotel to stay in Sydney and not very expensive compared to the others. I had a special offer from their website, I had to pay fully in advance but compared to the fares in Sydney CBD, this hotel is a great deal !

Reviews.Title: “Evening here - very nice”
Reviews.Author: DoctorOctopus
Reviews.Content: I was here one evening when I visited Sydney. A local friend brought me to their English-themed bar. The food was VERY well priced for the huge portions I saw. Staff were incredibly helpful. Drinks were also good price. Disabled facilities were excellent and I was pleasantly surprised to find a shower in the public bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Chellesta_3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a week long trip with my mother & we were both very impressed especially for the price we paid. The hotel is about 5mins walk from Central Train Station, 10mins walk to George & Pitt Street Malls & across the road from Paddys Market. Fantastic location, can't get better than that. We found the staff very helpful. Pub downstairs has reasonable meals (very cheap) & although the rooms are small, their no smaller than what I've experienced at other lower cost accommodation throughout Australia. Perfect for sleeping & showering - which is exactly what we used it for as we were out exploring all day & not at the hotel. Would stay again & would recommend for people wanting something cheap & central.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel full of history.......”
Reviews.Author: diannecaldwell
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay,clean friendly,close to the interesting end of town,not the yuppie overpriced end,the hotel is full of history,close to central station,haymarket,chinatown,stayed three nights,will certainly return in the future......thank you great southern........dianne caldwell.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two nights in October in room 620”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: And would stay again. We moved here after four nights in (company-paid) hotel at the pretty end of town. GSH aint at the pretty end, however ... POSITIVES * Lovely clean, neutral and (given the hotel we had just left) spacious room * Pristine modern bathroom * All we needed in terms of ironing board, iron, safe, table, chair etc * Didn't experience breakfast but on second night had dinner in hotel kitchen/pub ~ FANTASTIC prices for drinks and meal; to the extent that our doggy bag did for brunch the next day. * Upon arrival we were required to charge a $50 bond to our credit card. Refused to do so. Whilst we knew this was in case of damage to (prepaid) room, why should GSH earn (and we pay) the interest on this for 2 weeks. RECOMMEND that others did as we did ~ pay $50 upfront and get this refunded upon checkout. NEGATIVES * Very poor lighting in bathroom * Rather sparce bedding ~ we NEEDED to have aircon on as (like most hotels, windows didn't open) but one upper sheet and one blanket inadequate. Spare blanket in cupboard but having to get up for this disrupted sleep. * Maybe a minor point but ... the chairs at the lobby netkiosks were very very very uncomfortable ,,, and the netkiosks provided *NO* privacy whatsover. Perhaps the desks could/should be swivelled around. WOULD WE STAY AGAIN ~ DEFINITELY.

Reviews.Title: “going again”
Reviews.Author: oldie_9
Reviews.Content: A genuine Australian pub. Good rooms, close to the main (Central) railway station, an easy walk to China Town and Darling Harbour. Reasonable price for Sydney. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not a pretty end of town”
Reviews.Author: Gundagirl
Reviews.Content: Great value and found nothing to complain about. Reception was very helpful when we had credit card problems. If you are looking for cheap place near central station and Darling Harbour etc then this is a good pick for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Better than i thought!”
Reviews.Author: inky353
Reviews.Content: For $129 and nothing left in town under $300 (NRL Grand Final) wasn't too sure what too expect but pleasantly surprised. Had 1st floor room, small but had everything we needed - clean and comfortable although air-con was better off than on. Room was next to lift - really can't see any need for the lift bell to be that loud (or at all), thankfully only heard it twice as only 6 other rooms on floor which also has stair access. En-suite is closet sized but was clean with fluffy towels and awesome shower. Central close by so decided to have a few coldies in the bar downstairs before the trip to Homebush - great pub food, bangers and mash for $10 was good value. Full buffet breakfast @ $19 bit expensive, in hindsight, plenty of cafes nearby offering big breaky for $10-$12 for next time. Yes - will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cocamunga
Reviews.Content: Love that everything is just a short walk away, the meals were huge and delicious!! Great value for money! Yes the rooms are small but really.. Your only sleeping in them

Reviews.Title: “OK - does the job but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: DinFrance
Reviews.Content: Generally a tad disappointing considering the price that was being paid. Maybe somewhere between a two star and three star hotel. Watch out - sneezing may incur an extra charge. Bugged me that everything was an extra. Left our bags no more than 1.5 hours = $2 charge. Internet charge by two hour blocks and cable connection. All seemed a bit primitive. Had to leave a deposit (even though our rooms were fully paid). Breakfast paid at reception and then had to hand token over in breakfast room. Ok, none of it end-of-the-world stuff but all sort of untrusting and a harking back to the 60s/70s. It did the job but not sure I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Peta A
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff. Convenient location, within walking distance of Central Station. Clean, but tiny dated room and the wi-fi for which one must pay extra didn't work on the night that I stayed. Good breakfast but this costs extra too. They charge $19 for cereal. Summary: Expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: GW_pebbles
Reviews.Content: Location is quite a walk from the main city but there are plenty of different ways to walk in and it is good for bus routes. shower was good and room was small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: mandi2doors
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August 2011 and were not disappointed. The hotel was only a few blocks walking distance from the train station so it was very convenient to hop on the train at the airport and take it right into the city (get off at Central Station). The bathroom and sheets were clean (my two big requirements) and we had no problems with noise while we stayed there. There's a bus stop nearby that you can take down George street for only a few dollars or you can walk it, although it's a bit of a distance. I think it took us about 30 minutes to walk to Circular Quay. The walk was nice if you want to check out the shops and restaurants along the way but the bus wasn't bad either. Breakfast in the hotel was a whopping $20 per person...they must think quite a lot of their breakfast! But across the street is a huge YHA backpackers hostel with a nice restaurant on the first floor. My husband got eggs benedict and I got full Aussie breakfast and we both got juice for $24 total. I did get fish and chips from the bar downstairs one night and they were really good and not too pricey. Sydney is expensive and the price was great on this hotel and it was a good location. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star but ok”
Reviews.Author: tibballs
Reviews.Content: It was ok, if it was a 3 star hotel it'd be pretty good. But there is no way I'd ever consider this a 4 star hotel. We will not stay here again because there is much better out there for very little more.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: faos0505
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at The Great Southern Hotel and we can recommend it. The hotel seems to be renovating itself little by little and the main issue I found is with the carpet which needs to be changed. There is a pub at the front, it is close to transportation and it is really good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wouldntit
Reviews.Content: This is an old Hotel, but very well maintained. We found our room was very clean and well appointed. The staff were all helpful and polite. The bus stop to town was right outside the door. City Market 5min walk away, as was the monorail station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel With Character”
Reviews.Author: mordi35
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on recent business trip. It was pouring rain outside so nearly drowned getting across the road to the lobby. Once inside it was warm and clean. I enjoy hotels with a bit of character and this hotel had this. Room I was in was clean but a bit small. I was by myself so quite happy. Went to the bar downstairs for a cracking bar meal and nice beer. My room had an interconnecting room so could hear next door. They were quiet so wasn't an issue but could have been if either of use were watching tv too loud. I was happy with the hotel as it was near the airport train station stop in the City - Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect basic room”
Reviews.Author: bkpoalnd
Reviews.Content: This was a great, clean, and spacious room! The staff were great and let me check in, even though I arrived way Very close to Central Station and Chinatown. The common areas are getting a much needed facelift-- so this place is going to be even better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandysHomePatch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on 1st floor. Twin room for 2 nights alone and then joined by daughter. Enjoyed event at Exhibition Centre (2 days), Art Gallery, Peek Walking Tour, Trip to Manly. Great location coming and going from airport via Central Station. Bought a 1 day travel pass for trip up & down to Circular Quay and across to Manly. Located Free city bus loop to get down to Customs House and go on 'Peek' walking tour. Walked from Hotel to Art Gallery and took in the sights along the way. Chinatown & markets (not Monday & Tuesday) outside back door. Hotel served good reasonable price food. Plenty of food places around. Internet cafe across the road as well as access in the hotel lobby. Safe and wi fi available in room for extra charge. Staff very friendly and obliging. Room worn (ie carpet & curtains) but clean enough and bathroom small but adequate - good when you are out most of the day anyway. Not for spending time in although the TV was well positioned on the wall for bedtime viewing. Bar fridge/kettle etc. Room at the back was relatively quiet, only problem was shower noise from room next door, when they came in at 3am. When up and about this noise was not a problem. I like the atmosphere in the hotel very Art Deco a bit of a step back in time with all the modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but the beds were like concrete.....”
Reviews.Author: Firefly_3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a short holiday to Sydney. The hotel was easy enough to find, being a 10 minute walk from Central train station to George Street. The entrance to the hotel is next to the bar. Upon walking into reception, I was impressed by the art deco features and age of the building. Upon checking in I was promptly asked for my I.D. and either a $50 deposit or a credit card. I showed my I.D. document, which was checked and then scanned on a little black scanner I noticed.... the bloke checking us in did not tell me that my I.D. document would be scanned (or so it looked like to me.....should I be worried ?????) and he then just handed my I.D. document back to me and gave over the keycards to my room. The keycards are required to operate the lift, as well as access your allocated room for the duration of any stay. The room was comfortable, but THE BEDS WERE LIKE CONCRETE. I was starting to wonder that by the end of my stay that I might require the services of a chiropractor... urgently....The walls of the room were paper thin, although where the room was located inside the hotel, thankfully did not hear any traffic noise from the 4 lane road outside... Bathroom was a nice size with a decent sized shower/bath. The only problem was that there was nowhere to put PJ's or other items...the only ledge in the whole bathroom was above the sink and was still not really wide enough to fit vanity bag or other items. The only bathroom freebies were 2 random bottles of shampoo (no conditioner) and a shower cap. No soap. Also provided were towel/face flannel. The air conditioner in the room leaked on one occassion, but rang down to reception who sent someone up very promptly with some towels. I found that temperature in the room could not be adjusted and was stuck on 20 degrees. The air conditioner at night was a bit noisy but not too terrible. Overall this hotel was good, but would not rate this hotel at 4 star NO WAY !!! More like 3 star. The Great Southern Hotel is in a fantastic location, close to major Sydney sites/transport hubs, but that is about the only thing going for it. Staff are polite and offer prompt service. This is a value for money hotel, but not sure about the beds.....

Reviews.Title: “Donald is absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: princessyee
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually stayed at the Great Southern Hotel yet, but I have got to say that the Great Southern Hotel has exceptional staff and service. My flights to Sydney (today) were cancelled this afternoon due to the ash clouds passing over the air space. This was extremely inconvenient and has messed up many of my business plans. Fortunately, I have one thing less to worry about with GSH. I called the Great Southern Hotel, hoping for a refund although I was aware of their cancellation policy (I should note that I was rather impolite and pushy, but they put up with me and were very patient). Their staff recited their policy as I had expected. A couple of hours later however, Donald from GSH called me to tell me that a refund or change of dates was on the way. This is fantastic service. The staff at GSH really know how to treat customers to keep them coming back. Mind you, they are very strict with their cancellation policy, but in my case, with such unfortunate circumstances, they understood and made my life much much easier!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location, clean room. Really like it!”
Reviews.Author: Adnap0904
Reviews.Content: Spent three wonderful nights with my GF there. 1 min walk to Chinatown, 5mins walk to darling harbor, 10 mins walk to CBD. Clean room, great room service. I will stay there again if I go to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Most cheapskate location I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: kavela
Reviews.Content: The only plus point about this place is the location -- less than 5 minutes walk from Central Train Station. Otherwise, this is likely the most "cheapskate" hotel I've ever stayed in. They nickel and dime you for almost everything. The ones that I have discovered are as follows: - $2 / bag for depositing your bags. This applies even if they haven't had your room ready before check in and you want to go walk about without your luggage. - $3 for using the safe in your hotel room (key lock, not digital lock) - $10 / hour for late checkout after 10.00am. In the dead of winter, heating is not available for you to customise in your room. According to the reception, temperatures are kept by central heating at 20 degrees C, but it certainly didn't feel like it in my room. Walls are also paper thin -- could her the noises from the neighbouring rooms and the lift lobby which was outside my room door. I am a seasoned traveller (both for business and leisure), and I have never encountered such skinflints in the hospitality business. (The budget hostels don't count, as they cater for the bare bones traveller)!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for overnight in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: baytravellers
Reviews.Content: We had a great night here prior to an early flight overseas. We chose the hotel for its location close to central - and also taking into account the positive reviews. Reception staff were friendly and gave us a complimentary upgrade - to a lovely quiet suite with huge bathroom- probably the quietest night we have ever spent in a Sydney hotel and we have stayed in many. Internet was available on the ground floor - not free but cheap to just do a quick email check. We had a good meal in the ground floor restaurant/bar and left early in the morning feeling refreshed and ready for our flight. We shall certainly return - it is a convenient location for a short stay and even if we are staying elsewhere we would head to the Great Southern for a meal at pub prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls and expect to have to pay a lot of add-ons”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_pair
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in late May 2011. We requested a quiet room as the hotel is located above a bar that is open well into the early hours of the morning. We recieved one that was well away from the bar. However, when we got to our room, we found that we could hear the conversation of those in the room next to us. Not just muffled noises, actual conversations, and we could easily work out what channel they were watching on their TV. Only stay here if you are comfortable hearing ring tones of phones in the room next to yours. The hotel ticked a few other the boxes - cheap price, clean hotel, nice size for Sydney hotels, and a reasonable location. But, be prepared to also pay for lots of add-ons - such as a $50 deposit on arrival, charges for holding bags, and a $10/hour late checkout fee. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, so close to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyandblue81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic: bed, bathroom, tv, coffee and tea making facilities. We got a dark room facing the building itself, but at least it was quiet. It is so close to the rail station, Darling Harbour and Paddy Market. So we spent most of our time outside the hotel anywayI For Muslim travelers, there is a nice Chinese Muslim restaurant on the way to Paddy's Market. In fact, the same restaurant also has a branch opposite Great Southern Hotel. We were supposed to stay there two nights, but due to missing our flight we only stayed for one. I was grateful for the counter staff giving us takeaway breakfast meal set (cereal, milk, cereal bar and biscuits) although it was already noon when we arrived - welcoming gesture! I think the hotel can use quite a bit of new decor as it looked quite dated and made it seem not worthy of 4-stars, but the staff do make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sydney - hotel close to the action”
Reviews.Author: siwhiteley
Reviews.Content: So Ive just left a part of me in Sydney - its an amazing place. This hotel is on George street which is one of the main streets in Sydney and stretches for miles. Its within walking distance to the Central station, Darling Harbour and Paddy's market. Travel is close by. Internet if needed is also close. It depends what you want to do with your time here. For me, I wanted to get out and about and got the weekly pass for 57 dollars and did just that. You can get either a train from Central to Circular quay but id say get the ferry from Darling Harbour. Its the first time that ive been and as the ferry past around the corner I saw the Sydney bridge and also the Opera house. Circular quay is central to any travelling that you want to make be it to Manly Beach, Taronga Zoo or somewhere else. id also recommend to go and see Blue Mountains and make sure you get in touch with Skydive the beach in Sydney - truly amazing. Anyway back to the hotel. The rooms are either facing the building or facing the street. I switched rooms from a quiet one facing the building, but in darkness, to one facing George Street and needing ear plugs. You get used to it and the staff were helpful. Its 3 dollars a night if you want a safe deposit box. Get to your room by stairs or lift. Buffet breakfast is available at $17. There is a pub attached to the place where most of the workers hang out after their shifts which makes it a good atmosphere. Specials on the menu have steak priced at $10 which I had most nights. Happy hours are available. Id recommend trying the Carlton Draft if you want a nice lager. So all in all, amazing trip to Sydney and would definitely stay at this hotel again if im lucky enough to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Variety83
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times over the years and have never had a problem. The rooms are basic but have everything you need and the bathroom was similarly well-equipped. Most importantly, the bed was comfortable and I had a good night's sleep. This hotel is primarily a place to stay but does have a restaurant (though I did not try it). However, the best thing about the hotel is the location and price. It is on George Street in the midst of Chinatown with fabulous restaurants and shops nearby, and for $80-ish for a queen room in the off-season, itâ€™s great value for the location. The only bad thing is the hotel's lack of a cancellation policy. For that reason, I would probably not use the Great Southern Hotel for an event more than a week or so ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “My pick in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SGontour
Reviews.Content: Stay here for business a lot. The location is perfect, the rooms are small but neat and the hotel can't be beaten for value in Sydney. My first choice whenever I have to stay there on business. As long as you don't want to hang out in the room all day, cleanliness and value is my main criteria and this place wins hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel should really be 2.5-3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 7 April, staff were lovely and gave my elderly parents and I 2 rooms on 1st floor. Got to the rooms and was overcome by paint fumes with no adequate ventilation. The painters were regularly in the lift and told us they werejust doing the halls. We complained and were moved immediately to separate floors! The next night my mum had 2 cockroaches on her side of the bed and pillow!! Not what you expect from a 4 star hotel!! My room was ok and no bugs! Again mentioned it to staff who made a note of it and gave us free luggage storage for our trouble. Once we left the great southern we moved to a 3 star travelodge out of the city which was amazing and would be easily 4-5 star in comparison!! This hotel is in a great location and you can get a cheap full English breakfast across the road at the YHA for $8.40 they also do great meals better than thie great southern hotel for 1/2 the price. This hotel is great for 2 things: price and location ( only across road from free shuttle bus). Don't expect a 4 star experience because you will be disappointed! You do get what you pay for and so if you want cheap accommodation in a central location and don't mind too much aboutthe look of the place and cockroaches then this hotel is for you. However I seriously think this hotel should re-rated to a 3 stat at best!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will happily stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Juanita_Me
Reviews.Content: We checked in @ 9am coming straight from airport. Our luggage was stowed @ $2 a bag - we'd done our homework & knew of the 2% surcharge for credit card hence we had $50 cash. Reception asked if they could deduct the luggage storage charge from the $50 deposit when we leave - kewl! :0) Our room wasn't ready so we went for a nose around. The Hotel is Heritage, meaning old not new, but it also means "olde charm" and charming it was! :0) The restaurant was full & people looked happy. The venue was super close to ALL major transport systems i.e.the train, monorail, bus all within a max of five mins walk from Hotel. Hotel in CBD & Paddys Market and Chinatown were literally on the back door. We came back to our 15sqm (incl. bathroom) "STANDARD", "very CLEAN" room and found it to be very pleasant. The tonings were quiet and soft with a lovely, soft, warm, lightweight blue bed cover on fresh, clean, crisp white linen. The room contained a window, air cond unit, double bed, two bedside tables (compendium on one), wall mounted TV, desk with ethernet connection jack, a manrobe and also a cupboard that housed a mini-fridge. On top was a tray containing a hot water jug, cups & absolute basics for hot drinks. The wheelchair-friendly bathroom was a nice size with a shower, toilet & vanity, hair dryer, tissues, s x mini soap, 1 x mini shampoo & two rolls toilet tissue. We took a nap and awoke to one working light. Dippy us phoned reception who let us know that our keycard that opened our room & worked the lift also needed to be popped into the light thing by the door. If we'd read the card on the desk we would've seen that haha!! Yes at times we could hear the "neighbors" (we were in Rm 330) ... but hey ... it was after midnight and their TV was up loud but it was "dull" noise and didn't hinder our experience at all. Our travel consultant was given the brief of: something budget conscious (NZ$150 max) that was close to airport, city, all forms of transportation, shopping venues, sights etc. We didn't want obtuse decor' just something quiet because we were only sleeping in the room as our days were pretty full-on. She did exceptionally well we feel. We read reviews on this sight and were worried but those fears were not necessary at all. The staff were friendly & helpful. We suggested they replace one bedside table with an armchair; provide an extra towel to go with the two bath towels and two flannels; and have another option color for the pillow slips. Two white for the bottom pillows and 2 colored slips that match the blanket. We enjoyed this lovely, clean, charming hotel. The only bug we saw in the whole of Sydney was in the Subway restaurant around the corner from the hotel. A man walked in with one attached to his trouser leg. Ewwww! Thanks Great Southern Hotel. You guys were mint!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller8888850
Reviews.Content: I booked over the internet and booked a room with no view but we were given a hotel room at the front of the hotel this room was a nice size and very clean and bright. We stayed there for 3 nights on a bed and breakfast basis (when checking in they had no knowledge of breakfast i had paid for so always print out your confirmation sheet) â€“The reception staff i found to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to Paddyâ€™s Market, China Town, Central Station and Darling Harbour There is the 555 free bus you can get outside which is a loop buses that takes you to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? I think not!”
Reviews.Author: Gaillane
Reviews.Content: While the location was good, pretty much right in Chinatown, that is the only good thing I can say. On checking in we were confronted by a notice saying that there was a 2% surcharge on credit cards. In all our years of business travel, we have hardly ever been charged a surcharge and certainly not 2%. The room was not inspiring - no artwork or anything to break the monotony. The toiletries consisted of one minuscule soap, a combo shampoo/conditioner (1 measly bottle) which left our hair feeling like straw, a shower cap and tissues. There was no mini bar - you had to venture down to reception to purchase anything. The room had no compendium or any hotel information at all. Pillows were uncomfortable. We paid for breakfast vouchers, and what a disappointment - slimy eggs with uncooked white slopping around, anaemic baked beans, the most horrible sausages we have ever tasted, and something that looked like bacon but may not have been. I was woken up the day BEFORE checkout by a call from reception telling me that we had an outstanding balance. We were quite aware of this (internet use, breakfast vouchers) and would have settled as usual on checkout. Why we had to be disturbed and told this is a mystery. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AartiGagneja
Reviews.Content: This place is located in one of the hottest locations of the city. Darling Harbour is 10 minutes walk from the bridge. Its location makes it an excellent place to stay.City shuttle running free of cost can be taken from a stop which is very close to this hotel.Some local eateries near by serve awesome brekkie.This hotel is certainly not very great but indeed a decent place which is located in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “4 star expense for a 1 star accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: TerryCarol4348
Reviews.Content: The location was good for getting around Sydney by train and by bus. The hotel itself is old with a small clean lobby directly open to the restaurant and just off the streetside pub. We arrived early AM from the airport after spending 23 hours straight on planes and in airports. We were looking forward to showers and a change of clothes so we were grateful when the desk clerk very graciously put us directly into our room without waiting for the 2 o'clock check-in time since the room was already made up. Then there's the rest of the story... We stepped out of the well maintained elevator into a rabbit warren of dark and dirty passages that were littered with dirty dishes and linens to find a tiny, just barely clean, shabbily furnished room with the smallest bathroom we have ever seen. We almost had enough room for both of us to move around the bed to the closet at the same time. No way were 2 people going to fit in the bathroom at the same time; Just 1 person could barely squeeze in! There was an "inside view" of what amounted to a large airshaft that housed the utilities for the hotel. The sun never found it's way into our room. The air conditioning unit in the room thankfully worked but it was extremely noisy and a bit smelly. Well, to be fair, it may have been the carpet that smelled bad and the air conditioning unit just recirculated it. Hard to tell. We had noise from the hallway and other rooms that came right through the walls and closed door at night. The bedding was old and well worn but it was clean and there were no bed bugs...We'll give them that! We spent very little time in our room except to shower and sleep so we stayed put for both nights of our reservation instead of trying to leave. This was our first experience with an Australian hotel so we were concerned at this point about other "4 star" hotels and resorts that we had booked before leaving home. We're glad to say that the rest of the 4 star ratings were fairly awarded but how The Great Southern Hotel ever earned this rating is a complete mystery to us. Great it is not.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: kenilmehta
Reviews.Content: The great southern hotel is a great value for money. nice decent cozy clean rooms. great service and staff was very friendly. perfect location near central station. enjoyed the breakfast every morning and slot machines and a lounge was perfect for entertainment. 3 cheers to great southern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but...”
Reviews.Author: X32ace
Reviews.Content: Certainly not 4 star. At most 3. Rooms are small and awkward layout. Bathroom is an ok size, but the layout makes it awkward to use. Furniture is very old and there is no local or hotel information provided. Walls between rooms are thin. Every time the neighbouring rooms left the walls would shake. No views from room. Location ok for Paddy's Market and bottom end of town, but a little out of the main area. On the plus side the brakfast buffet is great, and the pub serves great cheap meals for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: chas93
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and tidy, but small with double bed, modern bathroom. My main complaint was the noise fronm the air conditioning units outside my room. Good central location, close to Haymarket food court. In house bar at front. Reception staff very helpful. Good for short term stays.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Maeve2011
Reviews.Content: Negative reviews nearly made me cancel my stay in this hotel, gladly I did not. We had a 3 night stay and were sorry to leave. great room, staff and food at the bar at a reasonable price - food so good we ate there every night. 20-25 minute walk to Opera House. Walk very straightforward, turn left at front door and keep walking. lots of shos, bars etc nearby.

Reviews.Title: “There is no 'Great' to be found here”
Reviews.Author: Narelle9
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that is classed as four star, it is such a shame that it does not live up to its name...there is no 'great' about it. Firstly, the two positives about the hotel......the location is great, (being only a couple of minutes walk to the Central Railway Station, a ten minute walk to Crown St in Surrey Hills and a short jog to the Botanical Gardens and the Opera House) and the reception staff were generally very helpful. Now the negatives.....the room we stayed in was tiny, the smell of sewerage wafted from the bathroom pipes, there was no view whatsever, the alarm clock and fridge had to be turned off due to the noise coming from them and the furniture looked as though it had been purchased from a garage sale in the 1970's. The worst aspect of the hotel was the noise levels....we couldnt hear any traffic noise, however, on the first day there were renovations being carried out and from 7.30am each morning all we could hear were the cleaners/ cleaning managers talking on their walkie talkies. Our room was also right across from the office of the person in charge of the cleaners, therefore we had constant background noise of people talking, people being interviewed etc. I would not recommend staying here unless you check out the room first or you are only concerned about location. Four stars.....I'm not sure about that!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NataliaG13
Reviews.Content: I write this review as a warning for any poor soul who might consider staing in this auful hotel. Please don't - for the sake of keeping your mental helth as you won't be able to sleep there. I chose this hotel because of its location, which is really close to Central station and booked 2 nights. I has a really important professional exam on 7th December and arrived in the hotel the day before. Here is my story... 1. I'm not peaky about the view from the window, but mine was facing inner part of the building and when I started undressing I felt that someone was definitely looking at me - it was an old pervert pieking on me from the pathway from one side of the building the the other, which was located right next to my window. I had to close my window blindes properly to get rid of this guy. 2. I started re-reading materials for my exam and noticed that some strange high level (almost an ultrasound) noise was disturbing my thoughts. I turned-off air cond and fridge, but turned out that it came from inside the wall (I think my room was situated close to general air cond system of the building). I turned on my i-pod and coninued my studies. 3. In the evening I tried to get some sleep, but the sound intensified (probably more customers have turned on their air conditioners). I was thinking of getting to reception, but someone was banging the door in the corridor with such force that my bed was shaking with every bang - so I considered I would rather stay in the room till the morning. 4. I was unable to sleep throughout all night and decided to leave this terrible place 1 day earlier. I bought new airplane ticket via internet in the morning and went to the bathroom to take a shower and be gone. In the shower I found a new surprise - a flock of really annoying bugs, which were trying to sit on me whie I was in a shower - so this was one of the quickest shower experiences in my life. 5. I filled out a guest form saying that this was the worst hotel I've ever been (and I've been to 20 countries and around hundred hotels so far) and proceeded to check-out. Since I've booked this hotel with a condition of non-refundable payment I didn't ask for my money (and seriously the only thing I wished at that point is to get out of there). 6. I went to my exam and I was sllepy through all 3 hours of it (since I didn't sleep the night before). It was the 14th and last exam for my professional certification and I was there in a zombie condition - great. 7. On my way to the airport the hotel manager called me and said that the level of noise in their hotel is absolutely normal but that they did find some bugs in a bathroom. So he offered to give me back 1 night's fee and offered me to come and stay in their hotel again - yeah SURE.

Reviews.Title: “The Not so Great Southern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rollo_100
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I made a bad mistake booking this hotel... I read all these reviews after I booked and paid for my accomodation! Something I'll never do again. This hotel does NOT deserve a 4 star rating, it deserves nothing more than 3 stars... The rooms are tiny.... I probably would have had more room in a storage closet. The rooms are old and boring and you there seems to me absolutely no circulation of air in the rooms unless you turn the air-con on. The rooms don't contain any information about the hotel, the area, the room service or the channels available on the TV... this is something every hotel I've ever stayed in has provided... including those with lower star ratings. I don't really spend much time in my hotel rooms... but I did expect a degree of quality... especially with a 4 star rating and the price that I paid.... I could have got something a little closer to the city with better reviews for only a little more. Overall I regret my decision to stay at this hotel, especially considering how misleading 4 stars actually is... and I'd probably never return to the hotel... However on a positive note the buffet breakfast was cheap and filling! That's the only positive I can find.

Reviews.Title: “Near Central station”
Reviews.Author: v01606344
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 mins walk to central station and china town staff: helpful but not very friendly room: no free internet access, the furnitures are antique, quite old in style~:P Cleanliness: average, could be better~ saw cockroach one night...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT 4 star, more like 2, reception staff rude - I was yelled at.”
Reviews.Author: getawayHobart
Reviews.Content: incredibly small room, no views - windows look straight into another room, bathroom tiny, nowhere to put vanity bags or items, dirty edges on bathroom floor. No guides or instructions in room, very limited tea coffee facility - both in items and space. Two single beds pushed together although the ad says queen bed. Very limited in every way. Would only rate 2 star. Reception staff very rude as we were vacating.

Reviews.Title: “nice and handy”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location just five minutes(walking) from main station it is at the top of the shopping area.Staff at front desk were helpful. rooms a good size and clean.it has internet connection but you pay. will store bags for you but you pay$2 a day which is not bad. pub and food on site

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad staff”
Reviews.Author: The___Excalibur
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the hotel is in a convenient location, main problem was the staff. I was served by a staff called Steve and he was rude, impatient and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel earlier in the year and gave it a good rating. I stayed again in June and was put into Room 517 - I don't need a great view out of my window (for the price I paid) but this room had NO window - a small skylight was the only natural light source into the room. I returned in August for work and was again booked into the Great Southern - this time I asked not to go into a skylight room and was put into room 305 - the view was of the wall of the building next door and the top of Market Place - but was a vast improvement on 517. So - still good value for money - the rooms on the side and rear of the hotel are much quieter - but steer clear of 517!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location and price!”
Reviews.Author: mjr_wollongong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, and I consider myself very fussy at times on locations, hotel quality and facilities. Have stayed on both times in the executive suite, which offers three rooms, a balcony, 2 tvs and spa bath for a fraction more than the other rooms. And to this I think is the greatest bargain for this city location. Of course George st isn't completely ideal to stay on, i find this part of Sydney to be dirty and overrun with Asian tourists and sketchy characters, but given the proximity to Central station and other transport, everything is merely a short walk's worth away. I wouldn't say the cleanliness of the rooms are top notch, but it's definitely livable and clean. I particularly love the whole 1920's interior and exterior of the building, and we always enjoy having a few beers and a meal down at the pub. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as title suggests”
Reviews.Author: kookyk_9
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the size of the room and the cleanliness thereof. The room was only vacuumed after I asked it to be done, the cups and glasses are only rinsed in hot water - yuck! The neighbouring room kept having phone calls at 3am which was very disturbing. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, good room”
Reviews.Author: tiana07
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are very small and have no view at all, we found the hotel to be great value, quiet, cosy, secure, have a fabulous location, is reasonably friendly, very clean, warm (it is WINTER), comfortable, have a good restaurant and is quite charming. We will definitely stay here again and I would recommend it to others looking for a basic, clean, quiet, cheap, central room with a fridge, TV, desk and an attached bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Only adequate hotel, but liked location”
Reviews.Author: Nyssa52
Reviews.Content: Room was OK. Said they gave us an upgrade, only to find it was 2 twin beds pushed together, I guess trying to make a king sized bed??? Liked having the fridge. Not super clean. They LOCKED us out of our room (we had 5 days left) after we had put 2 breakfasts on the credit card saying we were over our credit limit and that they had tried calling our room but we weren't there (duh, they think we vacation during the day in the room?) The breakfast (buffet) were cold. Liked we were near the Central Train station, and the free 555 green bus, and central market (fresh fruits & veggies). Darling Harbour has a restaurant called Pontoon that has 10 dollar lunches, & Nick's has good large breakfasts. Did not like all the homeless people around the area.

Reviews.Title: “affordable considering location”
Reviews.Author: melblore
Reviews.Content: located close to central station and paddy market. walkable distance to darling harbour. rooms were a bit old but decent enough for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent rate, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: nyalpi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a total of two nights, on either side of a conference outside Sydney. A$99 per room -- excellent rate.
