First night my room was facing back street, second night my room was facing internal courtyard. No views whatsoever, but I didn't stay there for the views. Perfect location, just 200 metres from Central Station (good for catching train for an early flight) and 100 metres from restaurants in Chinatown. Old cigarette burn mark on the blanket. Lift lobby a bit dusty and needed a good vacuum. Seems to have decent security -- you need to insert your room key in the lift before you can press the button for the floor you are going up to. Small but adequate room on first night, and on second night I got an upgrade because I had recently stayed there. I would give it 3 starts but not 4 because it just didn't have a the feel of a 4 star hotel. Not the type of hotel where I would stay for a long holiday, but I think it will be my first choice on future short visits to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay at Great Southern" again”
Reviews.Author: ardnaher
Reviews.Content: Before I start I left my comments with the management on departure so they already know..but I might add have not responded. Room not clean...cupboard had heaps of dust around the built in safe also behind and under bed dusty and well as rubbish left from other stayers. Small cockroaches running around floor at night and in bedside drawer. One night I woke to find two small ones run over my hand near my pillow. Could heard toilet flushing all night from other rooms and also conversations in other room. The only good thing about the place is that it is handy to Paddy's Market..just outside the back door....Chinatown and Powerhouse Museum and walking distance to Darling Harbour. In fact not far to most things but I would not attempt to walk to circular quay from there. We moved to another hotel after 5 days (Rydes) which was soooo much better and more central.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Conti1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sydney at this cheap hotel in January 2010 for 6 days .The room was maid-free and small , but in a good location 5 minutes from Central Station . Hotel seemed to be overrun with Chinese travellers . Good , busy hotel bar , restaurant seemed overpriced .

Reviews.Title: “What were those white marks on the blankets?”
Reviews.Author: skywok
Reviews.Content: The standard rules apply regarding the hotels location. Any hotel right near a central railway station will be surrounded by a slightly dodgy area with adult shops and the like. This is no exception. I am not sure what gives this hotel its stars, I think they must count the bouncer as a doorman (though there are 2 entries, you don't need to go through the bar). Star ratings are all about facilites, and apparently do not relate to quality. I thought this hotel would be a dive, however it was largely okay. It depends why you're there. I probably would rather pay $50 extra a night and stay somewhere like the Holiday Inn in Darling Harbour, which just feels sooo much cleaner. I was compelled to put lining under my belongings, as it just felt a tinsy bit seedy to me. The sheets were crisp, though there were white marks on the upper blankets - they could have been wear marks. I saw similar white marks at the Sofitel in Brisbane a few weeks before (though almost excusably... on the valance) The carpet was patterned. On closer inspection, particularly near the bathroom, you will find hair lightly matted across the carpet. I paid for a safety deposit box and hung a Do Not Disturb sign on the door which worked for a day or two, but the cleaner came in on the third day. There was a gigantic pubic hair in the door of the shower door after the cleaner left. The elevator trips had a combination of sweet elderly people and youthful sketchy types (one of which seemed to be on something). Service was straight forward with no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: I only paid $94 per night to stay at this hotel. It had been 7 years since I last stayed here and I was pleasantly surprised. Close access to Chinatown and the theatre district - a short stroll to Central Railway Station, and 5 to 10 minute walk to Pitt St Mall. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. I slept very well! It is a cheap nightly price to stay in the Sydney CBD

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Tishtraveller
Reviews.Content: If you dont mind hearing your neighbours talking then its fine. We had an interconnecting door to the room nextdoor of course it was locked but I could hear them talking as if i was standing right next to them fortunately we were only there for 1 night so we just put up with it. Room is very basic but clean. Room was very dark, hallways dark not inviting at all. 2 out of the 3 Staff at the front desk were friendly enough but 1 of them really didnt want to be there and couldnt be bothered helping us so we just made sure we didnt go to him again. Food in the hotel looked nice and very reasonably priced but we didnt eat there as we preferred to eat at Darling Harbour which was only about a 10 min walk to the heart of it which was good but its about a 35-40 min walk to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: gaylene60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel on a first visit to Sydney for the Edinburgh Tattoo and we were very pleased all around. The service was friendly, the room was clean (serviced daily) even though a tad small, but as we werent in it all that much, it wasnt a problem for us. Tea and coffee making facilities were available with a fridge, safe, ironing board and iron. We were on the 2nd floor in a twin room. This hotel was well located, just one block from Central station with Chinatown at the back door, as well as Paddy's Markets and shopping centre with plenty of eaterie choices. The best thing about our stay at The Great Southern was location and cleanliness. I would highly reccommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: mrken22
Reviews.Content: Top end of three stars rather than a true four star hotel. Very close to Central Station turn right when you exit and its a five minute walk. You will see the hotel straight ahead. Great deal at $79 per night for a twin room through one of the special deal websites. The rooms are small but fresh and fine a short stay. Ask for one facing on to Thomas Street, much quieter than George Street. Very close to Chinatown for cheap eats.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: travellersenior062
Reviews.Content: A few minutes from Central station .trains to circular quay.Renovated 1940s style .We paid $79 for queen bed room plus $15 ea for very good breakfast .Staff very friendly..Hotel bar out front for good cheap food.Toiletries sparse, need at least a second soap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: endilwen
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, but beware the taxi drivers at the train station! Look up the directions beforehand, you really are only a 5 minute walk away; I got in a taxi and the bloke drove me round the block 3 times!! Anyway.. this hotel is situated in Chinatown; you have to have a bit of stamina to get to the bridge and the opera house, but if you don't mind walking and it's a nice day, it's not bad. It has a grand entrance hall with friendly and helpful 24 hour staff, though watch out for the $50 deposit - none of my cards would take in their machines and I had to trudge around after a 10 hour train journey looking for a cashpoint in the dark - not great! My room was big enough for me, comfy double bed, room was cleaned and fresh towels every day, small bathroom but really big shower. Only downfall was paper thin walls - could hear the neighbours!! Also if you want to do your laundry, you better rob a bank. Good location for paddy's market, the museum, and darling harbour - but as i said, a bit of a walk for the opera house! There were also some very unsavoury shops on George St! Overall a great hotel in a better than average location.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for what you need”
Reviews.Author: Monimonica
Reviews.Content: As said in some other reviews, one of the reasons why this hotel is so cheap at such a great location is because you need to pay for gym and internet etc. But actually this is not a problem for those who don't even need all that stuff. Stayed there 3 nights this November and it was just a fine experience. Quiet, clean, everything in the room was working. - and thats all we expected. The staff were nice, and although we only booked for room service for the last day (somehow), they cleaned the room and changed sheets, towels on the second day after we required. We didnt get a outfacing room but since we didnt stay in the room during the day, it didnt really matter. Overall a satisfactory place to stay. and oh.. the location is just great!

Reviews.Title: “Poor standard for 4* and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Caipimichl
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the long weekend (Melbourne cup weekend) in Sydney. Unfortunately we booked late and finally we ended up in the GSH. The positive fact first. We arrived at 10 am and the room was ready for us. But that it from the positive point of view. The rooms was extremely small (where to put the second luggage?), cockroaches on the floor and we had a wake up call by the neighbourâ€™s shower every morning. No welcome information on the room, mold in the showers corners and finally a 2 AUD fee per bag for storing the luggage does not confirm a four star rating. We paid 380 AUD (yes, 380 $) for the first night and the other 3 nights 95 AUD, but we stayed in better hotels for that amount of money. The nearby Youth Hostels have probably a equal standard for that money and are also in the same central location as the GSH. The staff in the YH is probably more friendly and helpful compared to the GSH.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap rate but poor service & very noisy”
Reviews.Author: TravellingKiwisNZ
Reviews.Content: Benefits: central location, close to central station, price cheaper than other hotels in area, room was clean, slightly modern, 7/11 supermarket a few metres away, Chinatown and Haymarket is a couple of streets away, darling harbour is walking distance Disadvantages: 1) Although room was slightly cheaper than other hotels $110-$120 AU, it was extremely NOISY. Our room was right next to the lift and we heard people go in and out of the lift but we also heard people go to the bathroom in the room above us and we heard the couple in the room next to us talking and so on..all night and all morning long!! It was horrible and we would never stay here again because the walls were so thin it was really noisy. We expected at least a good night's sleep for this price or else we mind as well have stayed at a backpackers. 2) Badroom service - cleaners came in twice while we were getting changed even though we had do not disturb sign on the door. 3) Reception had bad attitudes and there was man who wasn't interested in serving/helping guests who needed to store their items away in day lockers - problem was the day lockers didn't seem to work so guests had to ask man at reception twice to assist them. Guests eventually worked it out themselves as man said it was 'easy to use' and refused to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: nealSrilanka
Reviews.Content: We stood here for two nights and we choose this hotel bcoz the location and low prices. Room was quite okay but the floor was noisy I guess. We got a room which has a view of the George street where I guess lot of rooms which didn't had any view. The place was very convenient its walking distance from Central Station, China Town and near to Darling Harbour. However you need to checkout exactly at 10:30am...overall good place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: royalbutterfly
Reviews.Content: As has been said, Great Southern is close to the Central Station, and it's easy enough to wave down a taxi. It's on George Street, close to Chinatown and within walking distance of Darling Harbour. You can catch the train or hop onto the Sydney Explorer bus at Central to see other tourist attractions. In the lobby of the hotel, there are brochures and maps of places and things to see. I paid AUD 400 for 5 nights in a room with a standard Queen bed - the room and ensuite were all right and well-maintained. The problem I had was that the windows didn't open, and I couldn't adjust the air-conditioner to less than 20 degrees Celcius. Given that I'd just arrived from NZ (around 3 degrees Celcius!) and it was unseasonably warm in Sydney for winter, it was almost unbearable. Also, what I paid was just for the room - anything extra such as broadband access, laundry, gym access, and breakfast had to be paid for. I couldn't find any listed charges for internet access either, although someone else's review says it's about 27 AUD. But there are nearby internet cafes! On the whole, Great Southern was still a great place to stay, especially if you're just looking for someplace to stay at night while you stay out all day.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: casastyles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good deal if you are looking for a short stay in Sydney. The location of the hotel is the main advantage,close to the railway station and walking distance from the main attraction of sydney. The rooms are cleaned and the front office staff very helpful. The breakfast was average but for the price you cannot expect more. During my trip in Australia I spent three nights at different times and the service, cleanliness was all the time the same. Definitely its a good deal for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Victoria451
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate for this hotel - for under $A100 it's cheap and cheerful, a great deal in the city centre. It's 2 blocks away from the central railway station and on the free commuter link bus route. The staff are young, happy and well trained, and look after you well. It's a good hike above a backpackers in quality, in the backpacker district. The rooms aren't by any means designer, but for the money they're clean and do the job, reasonably quiet. Right out the back is MarketCity, for healthy brekkies. The restaurant is of the steak and chips school, so dinner at MarketCity might be a better health choice :-) Overall I enjoyed my stay here, and found it an excellent base for exploring Sydney on my own coin (although would go a little more upmarket if there on business).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: selina_eve
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of days during a business trip. Didn't want to spend too much money cos I just needed a room to sleep in after work. Location was great as the train station was nearby. Booked my room through WOTIF.com a few days before the trip which gave a really good deal. Arrived at the hotel around 11am and check in was a breeze even though I was probably 3 hours earlier than the normal check in time. Since I have already paid, my actual check in took less than 3 min. However, the staff could have asked if I needed assistance as there was another asian couple checking out and he just assumed that we were together thus I had to wait quite a bit. Still, it was fine. Walking to the room was a little scary though so the security provided by the lifts was a plus. Rooms were typical hotel rooms but clean with comfy beds. Mini bar was empty which I was pretty amused by it as it was the first time I come across an empty mini bar. If you need something, you have to go to the reception to get it. Frankly, if I had to go to the reception to get it, I might as well walk to the streets and buy the stuff. But really, it wasn't really crucial to me. They had an ironing board and iron in the room which is good as I needed my clothes ironed since i was on a business trip. Shower area was a little tiny but what can you ask for the kind of price? I didn't get to use the restaurant or pub or internet. I already planned not to use the internet thus i chose this hotel. I knew that i would be expensive. Maybe if people can read before booking instead of complaining about it later. I don't think the hotel hides information. If not, just give them a call to clarify. Lots of food places within walking distance. Even though I was travelling alone and had to walk 10min to a restaurant at night after 11pm, I still felt quite safe as there were lots of people around. Overall, a pleasant experience. I will stay in this hotel again if I go to Sydney. But I will make sure I book everything before going so that I do not have to pay for the costly internet that everyone is talking about. If not, I will go to another hotel that provides complimentary internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hotel Great Southern”
Reviews.Author: ToddBallina_NSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Great Southern for 3 nights while we went to a show at the State Theatre. Overall we wanted something in the city, on a budget, but still with all the conveniences of a large hotel. We read a few reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to stay here. We booked via "Rates to Go" website as at the time they had the absolute cheapest rates. We paid $79.00 per night for the first two nights, then $119.00 for the Friday night (as there was a big event on in Sydney that weekend - its natural for the hotels to bump up their rates) - still cheap for a Hotel room in the Centre of Sydney though. All up we paid $ 277.00 for 3 nights. Gotta be happy with that. The Hotel is heritage listed - so the renovation reflects the overall 1940's charm of the building - a lot of the old art deco detail has been retained (old phone booths, smoked glass doors, old staircase) this was really refreshing to see - especially when all that is used in hotel construction these days is Laminex and Stainless steel...... The Hotel doesnâ€™t look much from the outside - but the facade of the building had to be retained in the renovation - all nice inside though. Yes - the Hotel is located up the "Dodgy" end of George Street - but this need not worry you. Always heaps of people around on the street, everything feels really safe and normal. There is a Public Bar fronting George Street on the ground floor which is quite "happening" and good for a drink at the end of each day. Area outside on the footpath for outside dining / smokers though. Also a rear entrance which brings you out to Market City / Chinatown area. There is a Restaurant inside the hotel just off the Foyer - it never looked very busy though - so we ate elsewhere. There is also a gaming lounge within the hotel with another bar and pokies - but you donâ€™t really see this unless you want to walk through it to the front bar. Our room - like I said - was renovated (prob for the 2000 Sydney Olympics). We fronted onto a courtyard - so had natural light. This area all looked newly built. The room is small, but has everything you need - think a standard hotel room - Bar fridge, Jug, Cable TV, Double bed, Wardrobe, Desk, chair, Bathroom, Toilet, Hair Dryer. - Actually our hair dryer didnâ€™t work - so housekeeping came up straight away and installed a brand new one - no questions asked. Bed was very comfy - Blockout curtains so youâ€™ll sleep in...... The rooms all are decorated in a Heritage style to match the hotel art deco era - all very nice and Iâ€™d say 4 star quality. Small rooms - but they were usable and not too small. The location of the hotel is very handy to Paddyâ€™s Market, Chinatown, QVB, 2 blocks from the Airport train line at Central Station, Close to the theatre's, Darling Harbour, Spanish Quarter, Hyde Park. Walk into the city is about 6 blocks and takes about 10 mins. But there is a also a free bus to major inner city stops which runs down George Street - or the Train if you pref. we just walked everywhere - take comfy shoes. Tip - If youâ€™re going to walk down to Circular Quay, stroll over to Hyde Park and walk through it to get to the Harbour - a beautiful walk in the Morning with take away coffee and Portuguese Custard Tart. This will save all the stop / Go at the intersections and traffic lights down George Street. Hotel Great Southern - you have our future business...... we wont be ripped off by the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer I found this place very good value ($70 a night). It is a large rambling hotel built in the 1930s and refurbished in very fetching art deco style. Location is fine for most purposes: very close to Central Station, Sydney's main rail hub, and the Sydney terminal for long distance coaches (buses). The tourist spots of Darling Harbour and Chinatown are about 10 minutes walk. The hotel seemed to have a wide range of guests: Asian tour groups, budget travellers, older travellers and plain old business types like me. My room was small but clean, everything worked and the absence of a view - other than other rooms looking back at me - didn't worry me. There is a standard breakfast for which you have to buy vouchers from reception. The front bar is friendly with a good range of beer and wine and bar food at great prices - the $AU9 steaks are deservedly popular. Broadband is expensive, like many hotels the world over, but there are several public Internet terminals on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good rates.”
Reviews.Author: Gregga
Reviews.Content: I had to fly up to Sydney to sit an aptitude test and couldn't find anything suitable in Balmain, so short of having to go to a backpackers (I needed a good night's rest so had to go for a hotel) I went for this place in the city. For around $70 a night I got a small, yet comfortable room with a good queen bed. Everything was clean, if not just a little bit shabby around the edges (e.g. old TV, hair dryer had melted at the end, air con panel on the wall had worn out - but the a/c still worked properly, and it wasn't noisy). A good strong shower too. Best of all, it was quiet, just what I needed. And, in the heart of Chinatown it was fairly close to Darling Harbour and restaurants (about a 10 minute walk). The pub part of the hotel had really cheap meals ($10 steaks and heaps of other cheap meals). The bangers and mash passed the test - $8. Recommended for the price if you don't mind a smallish room with no view.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Security and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling090
Reviews.Content: My room was broken into and all my belongings stolen. No offer was made to replace my belongings nor was I provided with a new room even though the one I was staying in had a smashed window. Unstandably this sort of thing does happen but very disappointed with how the staff handled all aspects of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Understanding”
Reviews.Author: love_reviewing
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my inlaws to have a weekend away. Unfortunately, there was an electrical storm in sydney and my inlaws could not make it there at all as their flights were cancelled. I called to see if they could offer a voucher for another time that i could organise flights again. However, i was told that they could not do such. It is terribly disappointing as I felt that the hotel could be more understanding of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: moominoid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about ten years ago when the hotel first opened and was perfectly satisfied with my stay. Read a lot of negative reviews on TripAdvisor, but despite this we booked again given the great location and reasonable price. We were upgraded for some reason to a two room suite which had a view of the Sydney CBD. Generally the room was fine, there were just a few issues: 1. The air conditioner in the bedroom was extremely noisy and it was impossible to sleep with it on. It got rather hot and stuffy around 4am when I got up switched it on for a bit and then turned it off and went back to sleep. 2. The internet service in the room is extremely expensive - 55 cents a minute with a cap at $27 per day. And given that it isn't even wireless. Also you had to use the ethernet cable provided (as it couldn't be removed from the socket) and it prevented working in a more comfortable location in the room (I brought my own very long cable). 3. The hotel has parking underneath the building but it is more expensive than the car park at the other end of Thomas Street. Also when we showed up someone was parked across the entrance so we couldn't use it anyway. It's good we weren't already parked in the carpark and couldn't get out!

Reviews.Title: “no good”
Reviews.Author: tripp0ne
Reviews.Content: The hotel asks you to pay the full amount of your reservation at check-in and charges you for using basic things such as the safe box in the room. Not a good policy in my opinion. The hotel has a central location in Sydney, and this is the only positive aspect. My room was supposed to be a non-smoking one, but everything smelled strongly of smoke, and the windows could not be opened to let some fresh air in. The guy at the reception at nighttime had no clue about the internet rates, even though I asked some very simple questions to him: he seemed to have learned some technical words by heart, without really understanding what they meant. The morning receptionist (a girl) was much more friendly and helpful. Unfortunately I found a really big cockroach in the bathroom, and this encouraged me to check out of this place ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: Looking skywards above the pleasant art deco of the streetside ground floor on busy George Street, this hotel would be dismissed by many passersby as 'grotty.' I checked in on a Friday at around 1230 after securing an A$109 woitif.com one night rate - room only. The 40yo or so male desk clerk was pleasant and efficient: my room was ready even though official checkin time is later. Rooms are arranged around a central courtyard and seemed quiet. There is no view to speak off but at least it is not a blank wall with which one is confronted. My room had two twin beds: one mattress was quite firm; the other sagged somewhat. This was the only item I felt could be improved. The room was spotless, as was the bathroom. Water pressure was excellent, and maintenance of the fixtures and fittings seemed good. save for one of the beds as noted. The room was also clean with the only evidence of wear being a tiny patch of carpet close to the entry from bedroom to bathroom. My checkout was handled quickly and my luggage was stored for the day as I requested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Southern Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: longbich
Reviews.Content: Booked into The Great Southern using wotif.com for $69. It's one block from Central Railway Station which is the main station in Sydney. It's cheap for a downtown hotel. It has a basic restaurant which has a quirky rule of only serving Full Breakfasts (@ $18) so you cannot just get a coffee or a bacon & egg roll. The rooms are basic but clean. The hot water is set to comfortably warm so you needn't add any cold water at all for your shower. The bar on street level is popular with backpackers, office workers and inner city dwellers and has lots of cold beers on tap even Boags. It's right on George St., Sydney city's main street so you can stroll down to Circular Quay, The Rocks or up to Kings Cross if you aren't in a rush or to Chinatown right behind or nearby touristy places like Darling Harbour on the inner harbour. The main thing is that it's close to the rail station and all the bright lights but is relatively cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual four-stars”
Reviews.Author: Onward64
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the standard 'marble and brass' of most four-star hotels, then you'd be in for a bit of a shock at the Great Southern. This hotel is a 1920's pub that has been faithfully restored with a classic art-deco theme. At the same time, careful attention has been given to all the modern conveniences such as large wide screen LCD TV, ducted air and modern bathrooms. The fact that it is a real old-fashioned pub is both its strength and its weakness. It oozes character, but it is bound by the limitations of an old building; small box-like rooms without big windows, squeaky floors, small lifts etc. Despite it's modernisation, I still felt like I was staying in an old-style pub. The hotel is located close to Central station and in close proximity to Chinatown, markets and Darling Harbour. That makes it far more than a stroll to the main harbour area. However, buses run regularly down George Street and the train is quite close. It also means that it is in the rougher area of the city. Generally Sydney is very safe, but some people may feel more intimidated by the nightlife around this area of the city. Being on the main road, there was a little bit of noise. However, the double glazing reduced the worst of it. No noise from the pub below seemed to filter upstairs. Cheap counter meals are available at the pub downstairs. I couldn't see any sign of room service and the mini bar was empty. There were instructions on how to purchase items to place in the mini bar from the pub below. Not really what you expect from four-stars. Breakfast was satisfactory, offering cereals and a limited selection of hot dishes; Asian and English. There were no pastries and no fresh fruit. For an additional $18, I would rate the breakfast as ordinary value for money. Staff were helpful and courteous. However, the thing that impressed me the most was the bed. I have endured some pretty ordinary hotel beds. However, this bed was fantastic! It was incredibly comfortable, with a heavy, warm quilt and big fluffy pillows. If you choose your room on bed comfort, then this hotel is right up the top. However, the main reason that you would go to the Great Southern Hotel is the price. Rooms are discounted as low as $100 AU a night (without breakfast). You'd be lucky to find a dodgy two-star for less than that. This place is great value for money. As it is newly renovated, I suspect that this price is part of the drive to build up a customer base.If you're on a budget and your main concern is a clean, comfortable place to sleep, then you can't go past this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cheap meals”
Reviews.Author: margoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Great Southern Hotel for 3 nights (incl weekend). The room was more than adequate, the location was great for access to transport (and walking - which we mostly did) and shopping. The meals in the bar were excellent value and very good quality. Try the 280gram rump steak with chips and salad for $7! All round the stay was pleasant, with the only minor problem being the occasional noisy guest/s in the corridor. We requested a quiet room when booking and were put out of the way, so this wasn't such a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “good location but had some problems”
Reviews.Author: patience05
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location and close to train station, darling Harbour, china town, paddys market, etc. Although the staff were very rude and not friendly at all. They deactivated the card to the room which caused the lift not to work. We were stuck in the lift which made my daughter scared and shaking and we didn't even get an apology. They even tried to charge me extra when I was booking out of the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: hazpafis
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the best of hotels but after adjusting to the circumstances of the hotel, we realized we weren't really paying for the hotel but for the location, which was great! The hotel was near Chinatown, Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour, Hyde Park and Central Station. Breakfast was available in the hotel which was a relief. Lunch and dinner was not a problem as lots of Chinese and Japanese restaurants and fast food places and food courts were easily accessible from the hotel. Be prepared as the hotel does not have a concierge department so be prepared to carry your bags from where you came from to your room. Rooms are small but bathrooms are clean. Do not expect majestic views of the city as there are none. But if you're like me, the hotel will only serve as a sleeping and bathing place as you will be out in the streets most of the day anyway. The great thing about the hotel also is that its about a block away from the nearest Sydney Explorer bus stops. There are two: Central Station and Chinatown. I'd recommend the hotel mostly for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the rate”
Reviews.Author: golffore2001
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased. We had a room for three and although a little tight, it worked. Although a little far from Circular Quay, the bus and train was right there and very easy to use. The room was very quiet and never heard hall or other room noise. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great location for Darhling harbor and Chinatown. Paid 124 +30 for extra person (seems high for a few extra linens for the 3rd person)

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, nice location but depends on the room...”
Reviews.Author: CandyPants26
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on 2 occaisions as part of a 3 week long trip. The first night we stayed we were put into a room that was really a single with a double bed in it. My partner is a big guy and we had loads of luggage so we asked to be moved and the staff were great giving us a free upgrade on the second night to a much a nicer room. When we returned for the second part of our stay we were given a disabled standard room which was much larger and quite adequate. Overall message is that the room you get will make a lot of difference to the quality of your stay. The pictures on expedia show a superior room which you have to pay extra for. Despite this the staff were lovely and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: tigers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights recently on a 'Girls Weekend'. Now, this is budget accomodation, but it couldn't be faulted. If you are a fan of Art Deco, you will love this hotel, which has been restored back to the original fittings and the new part of the hotel matches this. We got a good deal of $126A per night for our single rooms. The location of the hotel is fabulous if you want to visit the Capitol theatre (we went to see Billy Elliot the musical) which is a 6-7 minute walk. The hotel is ideally situated for Darling Harbour, Paddy's Market, Chinatown and Central Station. The rooms are small, but very quiet. They are very clean. There are no views, so if you're going to Sydney for the harbour views, this is not the spot. You can catch the City Circle train to Circular Quay from Central which takes about 5 minutes or there is a bus stop out front of the hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is plentiful and fresh. I would recommend this hotel if you don't want to spend a fortune on your accomodation, but need somewhere clean and comfortable to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear...”
Reviews.Author: Commander_Pants
Reviews.Content: The Good Booked Online $130AU for 2 people including breakfast Slow check-in The Bad The aircon didn't work The walls were paper thin The door to the bathroom didn't shut This was my first experience with 'budget' accomodation in Sydney - oh my.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: natbaker75
Reviews.Content: This is DEFINITELY not a four star hotel, as it was advertised on last minute.com. It is however, clean, and the staff are fantastic! It's an art deco hotel, which means that the rooms are tiny. It is a decent half hour walk from the Rocks and Circular Quay. Central Station is literally over the road and Paddy's Markets are not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JRL_Oz
Reviews.Content: If you're under the impression that all accommodation in Sydney is really expensive for what you get, think again. I thought this place was great value for the very reasonable price I'd paid. This hotel began its current life in a 1930s heritage building (which replaced an earlier hotel), but the rooms are in a much more modern six storey (or so) building hidden behind the original facade. The location, just one block from Central train station, is very convenient (and trains from the airport are much cheaper and less stressful than taxis). Reception service on arrival was friendly and efficient. My room was comfortable, clean, quiet, unobtrusively decorated, and equipped with everything I could reasonably expect for the price. Sure, it wasn't large, but I'm very tall, and I didn't feel the room was too small for my liking. I didn't try the breakfasts on offer downstairs, but I did have a counter dinner on one night of my recent stay. It was amazingly good value - $7 for a very tasty steak chips and salad, and a total price of less than $10 if you include the beer that went with it. I'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here with confidence.”
Reviews.Author: IwantoliveinEurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June as part of a tour group. We spent five nights at this hotel and were very pleased. We were a group of 50+ people, teenagers included, and everything we had to deal with was pleasant. The front desk people couldn't have been more accomodating. The breakfast was hot, fresh, and plentiful. The only negative I have was the internet cost. Being from the States, I found .55 per minute a bit extreme, but of course I paid it!!! My roommate and I had a room with two twins, frig and desk. We had plenty of room. Others in our group had rooms that were a bit smaller (ok...a lot smaller) but everyone said their beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. The pub downstairs offered a bit of nightlife for our group as well. The biggest plus of all was Paddy's Market steps away. If you need/want souvenirs, this is the place to go. You can also pick up a jacket or scarf if you find your wardrobe is lacking for the Australian winter. I read some reviews about the sex shops and all before we stayed here, but I have to say I felt very safe. I walked around the area with no fear for my safety. It is also convenient for mass transit with the train station across the street. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MaxwellSmart86
Reviews.Content: Booked the room for a good price on their website and THEN read the reviews on tripadviser. Wrong way around, so was a bit worried about what I would find when I arrived at the hotel. The hotel's location is great- near Central Station, a block from Paddy's Market, just near Chinatown, easy walk to Convention Centre and a stroll into Pitt Street Mall/ QVB. The hotel staff were great but I know it's the room you want to hear about. It was small, a bit dull and tired and I had to ring Reception to work out how to turn the lights out to sleep (pull the Card out of the wall). However, the room was fine. We were only there for an overnight stay and it was a great sleep in a comfy bed with good pillows. It was basically a suitable, basic room and a good shower. Nothing flash what so ever but it did its job for a good price. Would I stay there again? Probably, unless I wanted a nicer, bigger, more modern room with a few indulgences.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: sydneygal85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight, while attending a function at Darling Harbour last week. From the outside, the hotel looks old and decrepit, however it has been renovated inside, and the reception area is very elegant and classy. I found the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful, and the hotel as a whole to be alot more personal than other places I have stayed at. The room we were allocated was absolutely tiny! Do not expect a luxurious room while staying at this place! Extremely cramped with no amenities, just a bed, TV, and bathroom all crammed into a tiny space. No view whatsoever, hardly any natural sunlight as all. However, we were only using the room as a sleeping point, so it didn't affect us too much. Keep in mind our room was only a standard one, so those willing to pay a bit extra would probably be allocated a better room!! This hotel is good for travellers wishing to stay for a limited period (ie:overnight) and are just after basic accomodation, and a clean bed. As I mentioned earlier, the interior of the hotel is very elegant and classy, and the staff were extremely accomodating, it's really only the rooms which let it down! I would not recommend it for families, or people staying in Sydney for more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, dirty, dark and run-down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a secret hotel on last minute.com. the description said it was 4 star - it was more like a backpackers. The room they gave me stank, it was dark, and so old and dated it felt dirty. I went shopping and was so upset with the booking that I immediately booked myself into the Sofitel Wentworth..not much more than I paid at the Pacific but soooo much better. Stay here if you are happy with dirty backpaker accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: London4
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed by this hotel. although it's located on George Street - it's way down at the bottom of the street, so a good 30 minute walk to the Docks. The hotel staff were unfriendly and the room was very average. Our air-conditioning unit was not working and we couldn't open the windows. The hotel charged you to use the gymj, which I found was a cheek. Generally, we were not at all impressed and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JeannetteLowe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there March 2006, had double room on 6th floor at the back away from traffic noise which was clean and fresh, large clean bathroom with plenty of hot water and good shower. Short walk from Darling Harbour and central railway station. Even walking distance to Harbour Bridge. Plenty of shops and places to eat nearby. Paddy's Market 2 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, cramped room”
Reviews.Author: wallydog1
Reviews.Content: What a shock!!! Dropped off at the rear enterance of the hotel which had bins outside full of foul smelling rubbish and the place next door was boarded up with flyers on the wall. I'd had lovely hotels during my stay and my travel agent made the worst choice of his life. The hotel room was dirty (vomit between the bed and bedside cupboard) holes in the bedsheets, rest of the bedding rather grubby too dark dingy room extremely cramped. Bathroom left a lot to be desired. The main street to the front of the hotel was full of sex shops. Only good thing about this place was the location which made it really easy to get around the city and beyond. Food was terrible oh! And if you want a decentish breakfast try the backpackers hotel over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Never again..”
Reviews.Author: Rickard
Reviews.Content: When we entered the front desk we first thought we where in East Berlin 1973.. The staff was really rude and had no interest in get any service at all. The door to our bathroom had stains of blood and under the bed a mini Sydney zoo was found... The only good thing with this hotel is that it has close location to darling harbour. Donâ€™t stay here, you will regret it I promise!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in december. Great location, 2 mins walk from train station and 5 mins to Darling Harbour. Rooms small, but good. Service ok, they let us store the luggage before we could check in and gave us a room as soon as they had. I you are a gourmet I would not recommend the hotel restaurant, it is ok but not more than that. The hotel is ok for a couple of nights, but I probably would not stay for a longer time.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with this hotel - Room 244”
Reviews.Author: Crowny
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of being booked in by my company for an overnight stay after our Christmas Party. It starts out hard to find as there is another Pacific International(Apartments)down the road and if you park for this you are subject to carrying luggage 15 minutes back up the road. Once we knew where to go there are parking stations quite close at A$15 per night. Check In was OK but I had booked a smoking room and was advised the whole hotel was non smoking. Arriving in the room was a real let down. Bad lighting, aged and worn furniture and a musty smell that could not escape as the windows can't be opened.The air conditioner had a rattle that was fixed with a couple of hits. The room was tiny as was the double bed, my feet hung over the edge. It was so dismal that we forsake the bottle of wine we brought and went to the bar which is quite good. Upon returning after the party we had a reasonable sleep until 4AM when numerous young men returned to next door which highlighted paper thin walls. The bathroom was as big as the room but had no shower screen and water pressure and temperature were a problem and the toilet leaked. Breakfast is A$11 per person and upon arriving we were sent back to reception to buy a ticket before entering the area and they were reluctant to add this to the room and requested cash. The breakfast was not to my liking, cold bacon, no serviettes, the orange juice was empty and this was only fixed after making a complaint. All in all I would never stay here again whatever the circumstance as there are far better and cheaper hotels closer to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: perfectmuse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific for three weeks during Feb. and March of 2005. The staff were extremely helpful and the room immaculate. The buffet breakfast, which was included in the cost of my room, was fantastic with a great choice of hot and cold. This hotel is fabulous value for money and I would definitely go again and recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Sydney.

HotelInfo.Name: The Great Southern Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 717 George St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Pacific International Hotel Sydney)
